Mhmm. Talking to a couple voice talents I know, COVID has made it way harder for getting good gigs. Everyone and their mother is working from home and trying out voice acting from their closets in their free time.
Saturated the market, taking jobs for pennies on the dollar from what they used to go for.
Like, Fiverr hurt a lot. But this is next level saturation.
stuff like Fiver probably attracted a lot of casuals at least to try stuff like that out
Like "What ELSE can I try and do!?"
plus just youtube channels spawning everywhere
I'll do an ad spot for $150. Or they'll get another guy to do it for $15. And if you find yourself listening to ads on the radio, you can actually hear the loss in quality for a lot of em.
(...3 hours later..) *yaawwnn* the music stops playing, which means the stream has ended.
Though some of those mobile ads are INTENTIONALLY bad. No joke. They want bad performances.
like just another person yaking at people etc?
I did some work for Lilith Games, and they had me do retakes to make me sound as over the top ridiculous as possible.
maybe to sound out of the ordinary, like they say slight accents pique people's interest
or at least engage their mind more actively

ah yeah, kinda makes you need to listen to be like "what's NEXT!?"
No joke, I think it's to attract stupid people to their cash shop games. Kind of like how email scams intentionally misspell things to weed out the intelligent.
